title: Dielectric added - charge voltage and energy

content.description: Capacitor <math alttext="C sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is connected to a battery of potential difference <math alttext="delta V sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. A second identical capacitor <math alttext="C sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is also connected to a battery of potential difference <math alttext="delta V sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The capacitors reach a steady state.
content.question: The capacitors remain connected to the batteries, and a dielectric slab with constant <math alttext="kappa" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>κ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is inserted between the plates in capacitor <math alttext="C sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following best represents the charges <math alttext="Q sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Q sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, the potential differences <math alttext="delta V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta V sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the stored energies <math alttext="U sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for capacitors <math alttext="C sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, respectively, after the capacitors again reach a steady state?

choices.label: <math alttext="Q sub 1 is greater than Q sub 2; delta V sub 1 is greater than delta V sub 2; U sub 1 is greater than U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>;</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>;</mo><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Q sub 1 is greater than Q sub 2; delta V sub 1 is equal to delta V sub 2; U sub 1 is greater than U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>;</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>;</mo><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Q sub 1 is equal to Q sub 2; delta V sub 1 is equal to delta V sub 2; U sub 1 is equal to U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>;</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>;</mo><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Q sub 1 is equal to Q sub 2; delta V sub 1 is less than delta V sub 2; U sub 1 is equal to U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>;</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>;</mo><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Q sub 1 is less than Q sub 2; delta V sub 1 is less than delta V sub 2; U sub 1 is less than U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>;</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>;</mo><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="Q sub 1 is greater than Q sub 2; delta V sub 1 is equal to delta V sub 2; U sub 1 is greater than U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>;</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>;</mo><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
